settings.heading: Rains
settings.description: Our process begins with the rain. When clouds become saturated, droplets fall from the sky.

settings.heading: First Flush
settings.description: Rainfall is a naturally cleansing event. During the ﬁrst few minutes, the raindrops clean the atmosphere and wash away any dirt or debris from surface areas.

settings.heading: Collect
settings.description: At this cleanest point in the rain cycle, we collect the pure raindrops into large storage vessels.

settings.heading: Filter
settings.description: Then use a simple, yet eﬀective combination of ozone and microﬁltration to ensure our rainwater surpasses the highest drinking water standards.

settings.heading: Bottle
settings.description: We pour the pure, refreshing rainwater into glass bottles and aluminum cans, packaging as inﬁnitely renewable as the water itself.

settings.heading: Distribute Locally
settings.description: Richard’s is building a network of collection systems across the country to ensure our rainwater is local everywhere.

settings.heading: End Result
settings.description: The purest, best-tasting water comes from the sky. Richard’s — Sip the Sky™.

settings.heading: The Rainwater Model
settings.introduction: What do you see when you look up at the clouds? At Richard’s Rainwater we see the greatest source of pure, delicious water looking right back down at us. We’ve invented a simple, powerful technology to collect and bottle rainwater.

settings.quote_text: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consec tetuer adipiscing elit, sed diam nonummy nibh euismod tincidunt ut laoreet dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat.

settings.title: Saved
settings.content: Most importantly, our collection process saved over 400k gallons of water. That’s enough water to hydrate 2000 people for an entire year!

settings.title: Optimized
settings.content: We optimized our packaging and are on track to save almost 50k pounds of cardboard in 2023. That’s equal to saving 586 trees!

settings.title: Diverted
settings.content: Diverted 7,725,224 plastic bottles from use, but we didn’t stop there!

settings.title: Richard catches his first drop
settings.content: Tired of well water that produced dirty dishes, dry hair, and cardboard-stiff jeans, Richard installed a rain collection system. He creates Tank Town to provide rainwater to his neighbors.

settings.title: Richard builds Tank Town
settings.content: Right outside of Austin, Texas, Tank Town is the birthplace of Richard’s Rainwater.

settings.title: Pioneering Bottled
settings.content: In 2002, Richard’s Rainwater becomes the first company in the nation to receive licensing to bottle and distribute rainwater.

settings.title: Developing Sparkling Rainwater
settings.content: Since rainwater is free of minerals and additives, carbonation was a challenge. Richard developed his own recipe using time, ice-cold temps, and pressure.

settings.title: Expanding with Lazy Magnolia
settings.content: Rainwater can be collected almost anywhere, making it the most sustainable water source. Richard’s partners with Lazy Magnolia Brewing in Mississippi to expand rain-catching operations.

settings.title: Growing with Faubourg
settings.content: Our newest partner, located in New Orleans, one of the top 3 Rainiest cities in the US. The World’s largest potable rainwater collection site.

settings.heading: Find Richard’s near you.
settings.subheading: If it rains where you live, there’s a good chance our rainwater is ‘round the corner.
